required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Playtime Open Globe Injuries in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Epidemiology, Aetiologies, and Complications of Playtime Open-globe Injuries in Children

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigated the epidemiology, aetiologies, and complications of playtime open-globe injuries in children at the Assiut University Hospital, Egypt, between January to July 2016.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective study was conducted at the Department of Ophthalmology, Assiut University Hospital, which is the largest tertiary referral hospital in Upper Egypt and provides 24-hour ophthalmic emergency services for six governorates. The study included all children (age ≤18 years) admitted with open-globe injuries that occurred during playtime over a 6-month study period. Demographic information (age and sex), the site and mechanism of injury, the site of ocular laceration (corneal, scleral or corneoscleral) and associated complications were recorded and analysed.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual acuity (in Decimal using Snellen chart) after repair of open globe injury
primary_outcome.description: measurement of corrected distant visual acuity after wound repair.

intervention.description: repair of corneal, corneoscleral, or scleral wounds

study_pop.textblock: all children (age ≤18 years) admitted to Assiut university hospital with open-globe injuries that occurred during playtime over a 6-month study period (January-July 2016).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all children (age ≤18 years) admitted with open-globe injuries that occurred during playtime over a 6-month study period (January-July 2016).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Open globe injuries in patients olader than 18 years.
- Closed globe injuries
